channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump, Netanyahu meet over ceasefire. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted strike
item.description: Conditions are dire for people in Gaza as President Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss the next phase of the ceasefire deal. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of an attempted drone strike.
item.content:encoded:
Conditions are dire for people in Gaza as President Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss the next phase of the ceasefire deal. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of an attempted drone strike.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
item.description: China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of what it calls "Justice Mission 2025."
item.content:encoded:
China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of what it calls "Justice Mission 2025."

(Image credit: Chiang Ying-ying)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Policy relief for family caregivers seems stalled out. But there are signs of change
item.description: Family members carry the burden and costs of caring for America's aging population. Federal policy change is slow to come but a new movement and state actions are building momentum.
item.content:encoded:
Family members carry the burden and costs of caring for America's aging population. Federal policy change is slow to come but a new movement and state actions are building momentum.

(Image credit: Paul Morigi)
item.dc:creator: Kat McGowan

item.title: Federal appeals court judge is accused of bullying her clerks
item.description: The Legal Accountability Project complaint, which has not been previously reported, states that it is based on conversations with multiple former law clerks.
item.content:encoded:
The Legal Accountability Project complaint, which has not been previously reported, states that it is based on conversations with multiple former law clerks.

(Image credit: Mark Lennihan)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Thousands watch livestream of Maine family's food pantry for deer
item.description: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.content:encoded: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: FIFA president defends World Cup ticket prices, saying demand is hitting records
item.description: The FIFA President addressed outrage over ticket prices for the World Cup by pointing to record demand and reiterating that most of the proceeds will help support soccer around the world.
item.content:encoded:
The FIFA President addressed outrage over ticket prices for the World Cup by pointing to record demand and reiterating that most of the proceeds will help support soccer around the world.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: From chess to a medical mystery: Great global reads from 2025 you may have missed
item.description: We published hundreds of stories on global health and development each year. Some are ... alas ... a bit underappreciated by readers. We've asked our staff for their favorite overlooked posts of 2025.
item.content:encoded:
We published hundreds of stories on global health and development each year. Some are ... alas ... a bit underappreciated by readers. We've asked our staff for their favorite overlooked posts of 2025.

(Image credit: Clockwise from top left: Danielle Villasanal; Viraj Nayar for NPR; Joanne Cavanaugh Simpson for NPR; Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: The U.S. offers Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee for now, Zelenskyy says
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says Ukraine peace is closer. And, how funding cuts affect anti-poverty groups
item.description: Trump and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled momentum on peace talks after a meeting yesterday. And, anti-poverty groups address challenges they are facing that impact Americans who need help.
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled momentum on peace talks after a meeting yesterday. And, anti-poverty groups address challenges they are facing that impact Americans who need help.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: 'Raising questions' isn't enough. The best films of the year took a stance
item.description: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.
item.content:encoded: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.
item.dc:creator: Aisha Harris
